newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hong Kong stocks slump to lower close.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks slump to lower close.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks closed lower on Wednesday after falling steadily in late afternoon, chiefly on selling in HSBC Holdings and a lack of buying interest before a U.S. Federal Reserve policy meeting, brokers said.

"Next week is a big week and investors don't want to roll the dice in advance of the FOMC meeting," said James Osborn, vice president at ING Barings. "I think we have actually seen a net outflow of funds from Hong Kong recently."
The Hang Seng Index closed 97.49 points lower at 12,651.42, near its low for the day of 12,650.29. Turnover rose to HK$8.12 billion, slightly higher than Tuesday's HK$7.52 billion.
